Posts.Content: May 18, 2016 08:16PM DebbK wrote: Hi, I know the waiting---waiting for tests to be ordered, waiting for results, etc. can be maddening. Try to do some things to take your mind off the tests while you are waiting either to have them done or for the results. Worse case scenario--even if it does turn out to be BC (and keep in mind there's a better than 80% chance that it's not) most breast cancers take years to grow to the point where they are palpable. A few weeks won't make much of a difference. I had to wait 5 weeks for my surgery once I had a diagnosis, and I remember well the feeling. You just want this thing that doesn't belong in you and that you think might kill you---OUT OF YOUR BODY. Unfortunately, the whole diagnostic process takes some time. If you need to keep talking about it to keep your sanity--then do that, but try not to spend all your time dwelling on the negative possibilities. Instead do things like listen to your favorite music, exercise, take a relaxing bath, watch a favorite movie etc. Whatever relieves some of the tension and takes your mind off this for even a short time will help. Most of all, be optimistic! Remember that the odds are very much in your favor that this will turn out to be nothing serious.
